title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises younger Red Sox players to simplify and focus on execution as playoffs approach.
Red Sox hold the American League's second wildcard spot with 13 regular season games remaining.
Bregman hits first home run since August, aims to lead Boston to a postseason berth.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution tied 1-1 with Toronto FC, maintaining 11th place in the Eastern Conference standings.
The draw continues Revolution's home struggles with only one point from a largely winnable game at Gillette Stadium.
18-year-old Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start, showing promising performance in central midfield despite team's playoff challenges.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Cora advises against focusing on playoffs, despite Red Sox holding second AL wild-card spot.
Red Sox have a 90.6% postseason probability; Texas Rangers trail by 3 games in wild-card race.
Cora faces lineup challenges against left-handed pitchers due to Roman Anthony's recent injury.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow aims to hire a general manager as second-in-command this offseason.
The GM role has been unfilled since Breslow took over baseball operations before the 2024 season.
Current assistant GMs Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, Michael Groopman, Taylor Smith, and Paul Toboni are potential contenders.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints, receiving a 2027 sixth-round pick and giving a 2028 seventh-round pick.
Polk, drafted in 2024, struggled with 12 catches for 87 yards and two touchdowns, plus off-field controversies.
Patriots keep two players from 2024 draft class, as Polk is out due to injury, with six receivers under contract for 2026.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots face the Dolphins in Week 2 after losing their last five games in Miami.
Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa is 7-0 against the Patriots since being drafted in 2020.
Dolphins' secondary struggled after trading Jalen Ramsey, but their pass rushers remain strong.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed at Roadrunner in Boston on September 12, 2025, with a Southern Gothic-themed concert.
The concert featured songs from her albums including 'Willoughby Tucker, I’ll Always Love You' and 'Preacher’s Daughter'.
The performance included a collaboration with Jae Matthews and featured the 15-minute epic 'Waco, Texas'.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars in 'The Senior,' portraying Mike Flynt who returned to college football at age 59.
Chiklis reprises his football playing days 45 years after Andover High for the film based on Flynt's life.
The film will have a pre-release screening and Q&A in Boston on September 14 before a national release.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents feature on Forbes' list of 400 richest Americans.
Abigail Johnson tops Mass. residents on list, ranking 27th with $35 billion.
Robert Kraft and eight others from Massachusetts maintain spots on the annual list.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox lost 4-1 to the Yankees at Fenway Park, delivering a lackluster performance.
Boston's offense struggled, managing only two hits, one of which broke up a no-hit bid in the seventh.
Red Sox committed three errors, exacerbating struggles against a Yankees team poised for postseason play.
